visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing hierarchical category composition using drilldown interactivity
visualization_explanation: This visualization uses a two-level hierarchical structure: 3 parent categories (Electronics μ=33.3, σ=10.4) with 4-5 subcategories each. Synthetic data maintains category integrity through constrained random sampling (Poisson distribution λ=8 for subcategory counts). The column→pie drilldown follows Tufte's data-ink ratio by eliminating redundant axes during state transitions. Color progression uses Cairo's preattentive processing principles with base hues (blue, brown, green) for categories and value-ordered saturation for subcategories. Pie charts employ Stevens' power law compliance through area encoding rather than radial lengths. All summary statistics maintain ∑(subcategories) = parent category totals to preserve analytical validity.
